summary: Why would Jon (Rhaegar's bastard who had vowed to wear no crown) or Sansa (a woman who got married with a southern dwarf) be...
question: Why would Jon (Rhaegar's bastard who had vowed to wear no crown) or Sansa (a woman who got married with a southern dwarf) be accepted as king or queen of North while Bran is still alive ? [Books]
answer:
First, Jon will probably be named KitN before the parentage reveal (as it was in the show), but more than likely it will be due to Robb’s will (which is still floating around there). This will probably happen long before Bran actually pops back up south of the wall (if he ever does). After the parentage reveal, there could be circumstances that lead to North still accepting him, especially since he was raised by Ned Stark and will have been their king and proven himself for a minute.

Sansa’s marriage means nothing in regards to the North accepting her given that a) it was forced on her by the king they were rebelling against and b) she can get the marriage annulled, especially given that the lack of consummation is well known (IIRC). It’s highly doubtful that in the books the marriage will be thrown in her face by someone in the North. D&D fucked up when it came to a lot of the Northern characterization and with female characterization in general.

summary: Ned Stark: King. Head of Stark Enterprises. Served in the War. Has a law degree. Keeper of secrets. Will actually fight you when...
caption:
Ned Stark: King. Head of Stark Enterprises. Served in the War. Has a law degree. Keeper of secrets. Will actually fight you when it comes to his family. Has four sons instead of three. Cherishes his girls. Pop to everyone but Sansa and Cat. Got his kids a pack of wolves. Are actually northern Inuit dogs. Is Jewish.

Catelyn Stark: Queen. The best stay at home mom. Has a law degree. Fiercely protective of her kids. Even Jon. Pretends to hate him but actually doesn’t. Will die for the people she loves. Robb is her favorite. Shh. Is Catholic. Raises her children in dual faith.

Robb Stark: Jr King. Will fight you. Then apologize that he kicked your ass. Eloped with the tyrell girl. Wary of Garlan Tyrell. More protective of Sansa than anyone else. Once stabbed Joffrey with a fork because he bad mouthed Sansa. Once bought Tommen a cat. First one to call Jon “Snow”. Is thinking about joining the military.

Jon “Snow” Stark: Lord. Angry Kitten. Ned Stark’s Bastard™. Is actually his nephew. Older than Robb by three months. Was born in a snowstorm. Just needs a hug. Brooding Master. The Prettiest™. Will stab you if you touch his hair without permission. Or his sword. Dated Ygritte but ended up getting arrested. Only calls Ned “Uncle” when he’s scared. Will murder you if you look at Sansa.

Sansa Stark: Hates being called Princess. eldest girl. college sophomore. Double majors in business and drama. Will probably go to law school like her mother. Loves her family with all her heart. Except Jon. That one isn’t platonic. Was the first one to call him a Stark™. He calls her his Lady. Never refers to him as her brother. Wouldn’t be surprised if her mother kept popping out more kids. Kid brother Rickon is her favorite.

Arya Stark:Knight. no one. Obsessed with martial arts. Has four black belts. Secretly dating Gendry Baratheon. But not really. Cried when he left for college. Punched hot pie for noticing. Is the one who knows hot Pie’s real name. Will actually kill you if you hurt her family. Frequently skips school to go to Gendry’s college.

Bran Stark: Prince. Somewhat of a genius. He and Jojen are computer geeks. Says he can see the future. Probably can. Was in a car accident when he was seven. Leaving him in a wheelchair. Says he can fly now. Only his siblings can call him weird. Rickon will punch anyone else that says it. Has Summer registered and trained as a service dog. Is obsessed with modern meds because it makes him happy that he may walk again. Likes Meera Reed but won’t tell her. She knows and thinks its sweet.

Rickon Stark: Prince “Rick”. Only Sansa can call him “Ricky”. Littlest of the brood. Was a surprise to literally everyone. Wild child. Is autistic. Likes to ride the back of Bran’s chair. Never actually trained his puppy. Can’t do anything without Shaggydog. Has free reign of the entire house. Will steal all of your sweets unless you specifically tell him not to. Says he’s gonna marry Lyanna Mormont.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: It's not good quality, but I was bored and had a few minutes to kill. I used Naomi Scott as the face because she's one of my...
body:
So I got bored and edited a realistic/genderbent Jon(Jen? Jan? Jyn?) Snow!

It’s not good quality, but I was bored and had a few minutes to kill. I used Naomi Scott as the face because she’s one of my favs(go go power rangers) and she’s mixed race. I really wanna RP this Jon Snow as well. Now why would Jon be mixed race? Well, I have a whole thing about that. Should I make another post about it? SHOULD I MAKE A WHOLE VIDEO EXPLAINING WHY JON, DANY AND THE TARGARYEN LINE SHOULD BE ARAB/MEDITERRANEAN IN APPEARANCE?

Reblogs and likes would be appreciated! Follow too or even message me. I’m down to roleplay or talk about anything! This Tumblr will mostly be used for my historical ramblings, nitpicking, and transgirl related things.

blog.name: darthprongs
blog.title: no homo but girls are breathtaking, bro
blog.description: Izzy. Brazilian. A loving gay relationship based on mutual support is my aesthetic

summary: Jonsa, "it's nice to see you smiling again."
question: Jonsa, "it's nice to see you smiling again."
answer:
Sansa presses her legs together, drawing out the buzz in her center. She feels strange; warm and cold at the same time, as if it is possible. Cold on the outside and warm on the inside, warm where Jon touched her with his burning hands.

She looks at him and sees him attempt to regain his breath, chest rising and falling in a disconnected rhythm. There is a sheen of sweat covering his body and he is shaking.

Was it good?, she wants to ask, starved for approval, Did I please you?

Her thighs are sticky and slick with his seed. She did, in fact, please him. Sansa hums, pulling the furs over her naked body, and licks her chapped lips. Do you still love me?

“Are you alright?” she asks instead, “Do you need anything?”

Jon looks at her, gray eyes wide, and smiles. It’s nice to see him smiling again, especially at her. He is so sullen and melancholic that she tried for days to make him happy, to make him smile. She bites her lip and runs out of things to say.

“I’m perfect,” he says.

Jon reaches for her with a steady hand and traces her mouth with his thumb, drawing a line in her swollen and red lips. She is aching all over. Her breasts, between her legs and in her loins, but it’s a good ache, as if his touch is imprinted on her entire body.

Sansa bites his finger, softly and his eyes darken. Can we do it again?

Jon presses his thumb against her tongue and she licks it, tasting his salty sweat on her mouth. He sighs. Do you desire me?

“Come here,” he murmurs, removing his fingers and pulling her by the arms. Sansa lets herself be handled like a doll. Her body is too loose and relaxed to protest and she knows, deep in her heart, that he will not hurt her. Everything he does for or to her is with a promise behind, a promise of happiness and pleasure.

Will we be together forever and ever?, she feels silly just by thinking it, but that’s how he makes her feel. Silly, like a giggling girl. Like how she used to be.

“Yes,” Jon whispers, as if he is reading her mind and maybe, just maybe, he is. Sansa does not care one bit.

summary: Being Jon Snow’s twin sister and Gendry, who is a rightful heir of Robert, falling on you, would include
title: Being Jon Snow’s twin sister and Gendry, who is a rightful heir of Robert, falling on you, would include
body:
(GIF Credit [ X ] )


- You meeting him when your brother meets him in Dragonstone, and him losing his speech for a second when he puts his gaze over you.

- Him making Jon a bunch of questions about you, and Jon starting by being a protective brother, crossing his arms over his chest and asking him back what he wants about his sister, making him asking, astonished, if you two are brother and sister, while blushing lightly.

- Him, once he have know Jon and you are siblings, approaching to you directly, trying to be kind to you and wanting desperately to know more and more of you.

- Him making you laugh with his witty words, especially when he mocks your brother, and Jon letting him to tease him a bit, just because he likes how much Robert’s heir try to make you happy.

- Him not talking too much about his father or his mother, but always being ready to hear the stories you have about the late Lord Stark, who was your beloved father of course for you, and promising you he will restore his memory as soon as he is in the throne.

- Him always finding time to spend with you, no matter what he have to do or how tired he is of his duties, and sometimes asking you to massage his broad shoulders just to feel your hands all over him, because he is -supposedly- really tired and stressed.

- Him promising you that, if you decide to be his, he will never be like his father was, and will stay loyal to you, taking no lovers ever, just because he fears that you could dislike him just by his father usual procedure with women.

- Him changing glances with you on the feasts, and leaving his seat just to seat with you and have dinner together, giving no attention to any other lady in the room, and almost ignoring too the other comensals because he is too focused on you and your shared conversation.

- Him asking you finally if you will be ever his lady queen, promising you that, if you accept, he will ask for your hand to your brother Jon, and if he accepts, as soon as you two find a sept he will marry you, to make the things in the right way.

blog.name: artofthrones
blog.title: The Art of Ice and Fire
blog.description:
Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire Art Blog, None of these are original works.  If you re-blog from here, keep the artist's credits within your re-blog! Background and Avatar by the excellent Prokrik.

Spoilers in some pictures! Be wary, I'm not responsible for your discoveries!

Use the home link, or the orange top right X to navigate back home. 

Use the search or the image tags to find your favorite houses/characters. "HLS4" for histories and lore of season 4.

summary: Many people believe that Sansa and Jon will not be the first to reunite in the books. While D&D have made extensive changes to...
body:
Many people believe that Sansa and Jon will not be the first to reunite in the books. While D&D have made extensive changes to the source material, I don’t think this is one of them.

The belief that this reunion is not happening in the books stems from a few different sources. Most people who don’t think it will happen think that either:

  1. Sansa isn’t a “real” Stark. She won’t be the first one to go home. (This one also is worded as “Sansa has stronger ties to the South!”) or
  2. Sansa stole Arya’s plotline, so Arya will be the first one to reunite with Jon. (Also known as, “Arya is his favorite sibling, and that’s the reunion the readers have been waiting for!”) or
  3. The showrunners have said that Sansa was going to be in the Vale for “a while” and that was why they didn’t bother to adapt the plotline.

I can understand why people see this as evidence to disprove the reunion. However, the books provide ample evidence to the conclusion that Sansa and Jon will be the first Starks to return to Winterfell.

  1. Sansa and Jon are geographically closest to Winterfell. Arya is in Braavos across the Narrow Sea, Bran is sitting in a weirwood root throne miles north of the Wall, and Rickon is in Skagos. Sansa and Jon are both in Westeros, in areas that are fairly close to Winterfell and have fairly easy access to the castle.
  2. Both characters are canonically planning on going back home. The reason Sansa is still in the Vale is because she is planning on marrying Harry Hardyng, getting his armies, and taking back her home. Jon was killed because he was planning on going back home to save “Arya”. I would absolutely love it if both of them went back home at the same time with no knowledge of the others plans, only finding out once they’d accidentally surrounded the Boltons.*
  3. Despite their lack of in-text interactions, both characters have been reminded of the others importance in their lives. Myranda Royce told “Alayne” that Jon was Lord Commander and Sansa wished that she could see him again. Jon has consistently refused Stannis’ offers of Winterfell because he feels it belongs to Sansa. While neither one of them is the others favorite sibling, they do afford each other family loyalty and love.

Rebuttal for the anti-reunion points under the cut (for slight salt).

  1. Sansa is a real Stark. If you are having doubts about her Starkiness, see her referring to herself as “the blood of Winterfell.” See her building Winterfell in the Eyrie. See her praying in the godswood in King’s Landing and looking for one in the Eyrie. See her constantly rooting for Robb in every battle, and seeing him and her mother as the source of her strength. She’s a Stark. The fact that she used to like pretty dresses and her direwolf was murdered doesn’t make her any less of one.
  2. Sansa did not “steal Arya’s plotline” because getting married to Ramsay is not Arya’s plotline. It is Jeyne Poole’s plotline. And the fact that Arya and Jon are each other’s favorite siblings is what makes me think that D&D didn’t change this in adaptation. It would make significantly more sense for them to change the story so that two fan-favorites with a beloved sibling relationship met each other first than to reunite the two estranged siblings, one of whom is hated by a large portion of fandom.
  3. The reason D&D didn’t adapt Sansa’s book plotline is because they thought it would be “boring” to show on screen. They would rather give an onscreen rape and revenge plotline to one of the main characters than show her learning how to act politically, while giving a minor character an offscreen traumatic experience. The amount of time she spent in the Vale didn’t matter, because they were bored by the plotline and didn’t want to do it.

Many people believe that Sansa and Jon will not be the first to reunite in the books. While D&D have made extensive changes to the source material, I don’t think this is one of them.

The belief that this reunion is not happening in the books stems from a few different sources. Most people who don’t think it will happen think that either:

  1. Sansa isn’t a “real” Stark. She won’t be the first one to go home. (This one also is worded as “Sansa has stronger ties to the South!”) or
  2. Sansa stole Arya’s plotline, so Arya will be the first one to reunite with Jon. (Also known as, “Arya is his favorite sibling, and that’s the reunion the readers have been waiting for!”) or
  3. The showrunners have said that Sansa was going to be in the Vale for “a while” and that was why they didn’t bother to adapt the plotline.

I can understand why people see this as evidence to disprove the reunion. However, the books provide ample evidence to the conclusion that Sansa and Jon will be the first Starks to return to Winterfell.

  1. Sansa and Jon are geographically closest to Winterfell. Arya is in Braavos across the Narrow Sea, Bran is sitting in a weirwood root throne miles north of the Wall, and Rickon is in Skagos. Sansa and Jon are both in Westeros, in areas that are fairly close to Winterfell and have fairly easy access to the castle.
  2. Both characters are canonically planning on going back home. The reason Sansa is still in the Vale is because she is planning on marrying Harry Hardyng, getting his armies, and taking back her home. Jon was killed because he was planning on going back home to save “Arya”. I would absolutely love it if both of them went back home at the same time with no knowledge of the others plans, only finding out once they’d accidentally surrounded the Boltons.*
  3. Despite their lack of in-text interactions, both characters have been reminded of the others importance in their lives. Myranda Royce told “Alayne” that Jon was Lord Commander and Sansa wished that she could see him again. Jon has consistently refused Stannis’ offers of Winterfell because he feels it belongs to Sansa. While neither one of them is the others favorite sibling, they do afford each other family loyalty and love.

Rebuttal for the anti-reunion points under the cut (for slight salt).

  1. Sansa is a real Stark. If you are having doubts about her Starkiness, see her referring to herself as “the blood of Winterfell.” See her building Winterfell in the Eyrie. See her praying in the godswood in King’s Landing and looking for one in the Eyrie. See her constantly rooting for Robb in every battle, and seeing him and her mother as the source of her strength. She’s a Stark. The fact that she used to like pretty dresses and her direwolf was murdered doesn’t make her any less of one.
  2. Sansa did not “steal Arya’s plotline” because getting married to Ramsay is not Arya’s plotline. It is Jeyne Poole’s plotline. And the fact that Arya and Jon are each other’s favorite siblings is what makes me think that D&D didn’t change this in adaptation. It would make significantly more sense for them to change the story so that two fan-favorites with a beloved sibling relationship met each other first than to reunite the two estranged siblings, one of whom is hated by a large portion of fandom.
  3. The reason D&D didn’t adapt Sansa’s book plotline is because they thought it would be “boring” to show on screen. They would rather give an onscreen rape and revenge plotline to one of the main characters than show her learning how to act politically, while giving a minor character an offscreen traumatic experience. The amount of time she spent in the Vale didn’t matter, because they were bored by the plotline and didn’t want to do it.
trail.content_abstract:
Many people believe that Sansa and Jon will not be the first to reunite in the books. While D&D have made extensive changes to the source material, I don’t think this is one of them.

The belief that this reunion is not happening in the books stems from a few different sources. Most people who don’t think it will happen think that either:

  1. Sansa isn’t a “real” Stark. She won’t be the first one to go home. (This one also is worded as “Sansa has stronger ties to the South!”) or
  2. Sansa stole Arya’s plotline, so Arya will be the first one to reunite with Jon. (Also known as, “Arya is his favorite sibling, and that’s the reunion the readers have been waiting for!”) or
  3. The showrunners have said that Sansa was going to be in the Vale for “a while” and that was why they didn’t bother to adapt the plotline.

I can understand why people see this as evidence to disprove the reunion. However, the books provide ample evidence to the conclusion that Sansa and Jon will be the first Starks to return to Winterfell.

  1. Sansa and Jon are geographically closest to Winterfell. Arya is in Braavos across the Narrow Sea, Bran is sitting in a weirwood root throne miles north of the Wall, and Rickon is in Skagos. Sansa and Jon are both in Westeros, in areas that are fairly close to Winterfell and have fairly easy access to the castle.
  2. Both characters are canonically planning on going back home. The reason Sansa is still in the Vale is because she is planning on marrying Harry Hardyng, getting his armies, and taking back her home. Jon was killed because he was planning on going back home to save “Arya”. I would absolutely love it if both of them went back home at the same time with no knowledge of the others plans, only finding out once they’d accidentally surrounded the Boltons.*
  3. Despite their lack of in-text interactions, both characters have been reminded of the others importance in their lives. Myranda Royce told “Alayne” that Jon was Lord Commander and Sansa wished that she could see him again. Jon has consistently refused Stannis’ offers of Winterfell because he feels it belongs to Sansa. While neither one of them is the others favorite sibling, they do afford each other family loyalty and love.

Rebuttal for the anti-reunion points under the cut (for slight salt).

summary: Lyanna Stark [+Rhaegar] | Winter
body:
Lyanna Stark [+Rhaegar] | Winter

So I don’t really ship Lyanna and Rhaegar, but the show makes their story seem like a love story so I tried to portray that.
